title: Excellent view of Acropolis over the Monesteraki square
text: We went up mainly ro see the view, and it is great. The best in all Athens in my opinion. We would have stayed for drinks but it was very full and there was a line for the tables. So we just took some pictures and left because we didn't want to spend the evening waiting for a table. We went at sunset, other times might not be that crowded.

title: So beautiful surroundings and interesting history
text:
The place is absolutely stunning. The landscape over the valley is so beautiful and the history of the whole archeological site is super interesting.

In winter time admission was only 6 euros per person, very reasonable. It also includes the museum, which is worth visiting as well.

Can be tricky finding a parking spot. Not far from the town of Delphi, so easily walkable if no parking places are available at the site.

title: Unique interior, good cocktails
text:
This place is totally unique and awesome looking. Very cool! Can be quite crowded so go early or book a table.

We also had food, risotto and pizza and both were good. I would recommend.

title: Excellent historical place
text:
Go early in morning and use the South East entrance, it is less crowded. Be carefull, the marble stones are very slippery. In winter time it was pretty quiet in the morning and no queuing.

Excellent views over the city of athens.

title: Imaginative cocktails
text:
Excellent and imaginative drinks and cocktails! They come in burning, smoking and different forms, nothing boring. It's like sciense.

Staff is super friendly and helpful.

title: Self guided hike to Alta Canyon viewpoint
text:
We did a super nice hike to the viewpoint of Alta Canyon. Put Gargia Lodge to your navigator and from there continue to the gravel road for bout 4 km untill you reach the parking lodge. The gravel road is mainly in good condition, at the end there are some potholes, but just drive carefully and you should be fine with a normal car.

The hike to the viewpoint is about 7 km one way. Mostly easy pathway but I would recommend good hiking boots, since the pathway is very muddy and wet in some places. You need to cross 3 streams, for the middle one we devided to take our boots off and hang them on our necks and cross the stream that is about knee high at some points (note, this is in late June, could be more earlier with the melt water). All three crossings have wooden planks but the middle one looked quite difficult to use.

It's mostly gentle ups and downs, before the viewpoint at the very end of the trail there is quite steep downhill on the way to the viewpoint.

Before the steep part at the end, there is picnic table for some snacks.

It took us about 5 hours total with many photo breaks, snacks break and the river crossing operation. Can definitely be done faster too. We took our sweet time ;)
place: Alta Canyon and the Alta Dam

title: Interesting museum, worth visiting
text:
Interesting museum about Sami history and culture! We learned a lot about f.e. Sami people, shamans and even raindeer.

Very helpful and friendly staff!

title: Plane was late and toilet was horrible
text:
The flight was 30 minutes late. Not too bad, but it was a bit confusing, since there was one bus to the plane that left the terminal and returned to the terminal afterwards. There was no reason given of why did it happen. It seemed a bit weird and for someone suffering from fear of flying, that might have been suspicious, if there was something wrong with the plane or something like that. I assume that the plane just was not ready yet, and the staff should have announced that for the passengers.

Also the toilet was filthy with urine all over the floor.

title: Nice place, good location, nice restaurant downstairs
text:
Nice place. The bed was not the most comfortable one, but ok. Everything was clean. Decoration was nice and the restaurant downs rears also very nice. Staff was very nice.

The elevator is like the slowest elevator in the world, that was a bit annoying. Also I was wondering about the "no external food and drinks"-rule, which seemed a bit weird. I have never seen that anywhere else.

title: Historic coffee shop with excellent pastries
text: You can sense the history in this lovely coffeeshop! They have excellent pastries and coffee. The place seems to be very popular so it is crowded and you might have to wait a while to get a table, even though the place is quite big. Everything I had was excellent and I really love the original deco of the place!

title: Great brunch, prepare for waiting though
text:
The food is great! We had a brunch here and it was very tasty. Coffee was not the best, but ok. Staff was nice, although they didn't seem to like us having the bill divided so that everyone would pay their own food. Paying together is difficult when you don't take cash.

Be prepared for a wait though. The place is very popular so best to go in early. We had to wait about 40 minutes but they have nice text message system, so that you can go somewhere to walk around etc while waiting for your table.

title: Good location, cheap price, othervice very basic/poor quality
text:
You get what you pay for. Although i have stayed in wonderful and good quality hostels with less money...

We had a twin room. The bed and pillow were uncomfortable, the cover was a weird frotee towel, very uncomfortable to use. The toilet is constructed poorly and the water just goes everywhere and the whole floor is wet, and there is nothing to dry it with.

It reads in the booking.com description that there is free public parking at the location. Well yes, if you are willing to drive around for hours and manage to get a free spot by the street in the extremely narrow streets. So no, THERE IS NO FREE PUBLIC PARKING available in this hostel. You should correct that in the info.

Good things: the staff was friendly, the price was ok compared to pricing in Budva in general, location is good, just a few minutes from the beach.

title: An avarage old town, pretty, full with tourists, nice caffees
text: A pretty normal old town. It's pretty and athmospheric, but full of tourists as all old towns tend to be. Nic elookin caffees and restaurants, good for people watching.

title: Very basic accommodation, super friendly host
text:
The host was super friendly and helpful. The accommodation itself is very very basic, don't expect anything luxurious. The bed was ok, the room was clean, a bit cold because the weather was cold and there is no heating. The location is pretty good, about 1 km from the old town. There is a kitchen where you can cook food. If you just want a basic and cheap accommodation just to sleep, then this is a good option.

There was some noise from the construction work next door in June 2018, but not too annoying.

There is a small garden and i believe that would have been very nice if it had been a better weather.

title: Very touristy place, not much to see, littering seems to be a problem!
text:
The area itself is nice, nice little spring lake and nice views over Ohrid lake. But there is not much else to see. There is a huge hotel and a lot of tourist stalls inside the area. Very touristy. And what bothered me very much was the amount of trash at the shore of lake ohrid. They should deffinitely clean it up! There were trash just floating at the shore, everyhing from shoes to plastic bottles. Littering seems to be a problem everywhere in Macedonia (and all over balkan), but the trash floating in the beautiful lake is super sad.

There was fee for the parkin (50 mkd), other than that it was free.

title: Excellent food, service and location
text: The food we had was excellent and reasonably priced. The service was excellent as well. Nothing to complain. We were very satisfied.

title: Charming small hotel, friendly hosts, great breakfast
text:
Clean room, comfortable bed, great breakfast, nice views. It was pretty easy to find if you look up from the main street, you can see the huge sign. Be prepared to climb some steps.

A bit difficult with a car, the road was quite bad and there is not good parking space, but we managed.

Very close to the beach and the restaurants.

Excellent value for money!

title: A pleasant surprice
text: I was pleasantly surpriced about this hotel. Nice decor, comfy bed, good and clean facilities, friendly staff, good location, free parking, nice breakfast. Very good price for all this! The only complaint I have is that our room was at the bottom floor so there was no windows and it got noisy when the breakfast started, because you could here people walkin above our room. Other than that I have no complains!

title: Nice ride, was disappointed at the top
text: Nice views during the ride. A bit expensive in my opinion. There are a lot of tourist stuff at the top and no viewibg platform or anything like that. There is a hotel, restaurant, some playing ground for kids and all kinds of tourist stuff like shooting range, pony riding etc.

title: Nice settings, friendly hosts
text:
This campsite is in a super beautiful spot! The hosts were very friendly and after reading the other reviews, i'm very surpriced to hear that it was not the case for eveyone.

Tent pitchws were nicely in the shade of trees, the beach is nice and the little island as well.

Only negative thing i can think of is the lack of toilet paper in the toilets, but as experienced campers in many countries we are used to that. Wifi is nit working very well anywhere else than the reception, but I rather watch the sunset at the beach than my phone anyway.

title: Beautiful canyon, but the most beautiful one in Montenegro
text: It's a beautiful drive but to be honest, i was expecting more after reading some reviews. I think Tara canyon and especially Piva canyon are much more impressive! Maybe I just prefer more dramatic and rocky mountains, not so forest cover ones. Worth a drive, but if you have time, go to see the ones mentioned above :)

title: Worth a visit if you are driving by
text: Charming little monastery with a pretty garden. Worth a visit if you are driving by, but i wouldn't come from a long way.

title: Basic little huts. Very good price!
text:
The huts were very basic, each have a toilet and shower. Beds were comfortable. There is no heating so at night it was pretty cold. Everything is solar power so we luckily it had been a sunny day so we got hot shower :). There is a path down to tara river, worth a visit.

So expect very basic accommodation with this very reasonable price.

title: Excellent campsite with pool, hot showers, restaurant, cooking facilities...
text: You have everything you need in this campsite, even a pool. Clean toilets, good facilities for cooking. They also have a laundy machines available for use. The restaurant right next to the campsite was ok as well. The campsite was 15 euros for two people, 1 tent and a 1 car per night. Reasonable price in my opinion.

title: Super friendly hosts, basic campite with everything you need
text: Host family was super friendly and thy offerned a welcome shot if local schnap. Kitchen, showers and toilets are for guests to use as well as wifi. Nice view of the mountains! Short walk (about 1 km) to the black lake.

title: Pretty bridge, nice views
text: The bridge is nice and so are the views to both directions. It's very touristy though, a lot of companies offering rafting, zipline rides etc. There are some cafés and restaurants.

title: Ok food, nice athmosphere
text: Food was good, nothing special but deffinately eatable. We had lamb chops and stuffed bell peppers. A bit more expensive than avarage restaurant in Montenegro. Waiter seems a bit annoyed for some reason. Smokig inside is super annoying for non smokers, but it is so in all the places in Montenegro.

title: Pretty lake, too worn down paths for my taste
text: Lake is pretty. There is a path around the lake, about 3,5 km. Easy to walk path since it is pretty worn down. Lot of tourist jeeps etc. If you are in area, stop by and take a walk around the lake, not worth coming from a long way.

title: Excellent burger, nice athmosphere
text: Food was excellent, reasonable prices, good beer, nice athmosphere. Many options for burgers. Can recommend!

title: Excellent, fresh coffee
text: We took coffee to go, it was very good coffee. I had a latte. They brew it there so itcs fresh and high quality.

title: Great waterfalls, just a bit far away from the viewing platforms
text:
The waterfall itself was gret, but the viewing platforms were very far away from the waterfall because they are way higher. It would have been nice to see the waterfalls from a bit closer.

Good facilities. Plenty of parking space.

title: Amazing waterfall, crowded as expected
text:
It's truly an impressive and beautiful waterfall but as you can expect, quite crowded because it's so close to Reykjavik. But that is the case with all of the sights near the capital.

But the waterfall is still amazing.

title: Interesting memorabilia and tales from the region and the old world
text:
It was interesting and fun, but a little expensive for a museum so small (then again we are in Iceland...)

The setting in the museum was great.

title: Puffins up close, nice scenery, accessible by 2WD
text:
We were a bit concerned about the road there with our 2WD after reading the comments here, but there was no problem at all. Quite easily accessible with 2WD, couple of bumby spots on the road, but just drive around them and slow down. It took us about 40 minutes one way from the crossroads.

We saw a lot of birds, many puffins even up close. The cliffs are steep so be careful at the edges and lay down if you want to get pictures.

Beautiful scenery! We expected less people but still it was not too crowded.

Last toilet about 5km before the parking lot.

title: Good food and beer, excellent service
text:
We had langoustine pasta and pizza because we wanted to try local speciality. Both were good, not amazing buy nothing bad to say. Food arrived quickly, the service was excellent and the staff was friendly. Clean bathrooms.

Handfull of excellent Islandic craft beers in the menu! We tried Vatnajökull -beer and enjoyed.

Nothing to complain about his place, I would recommend.

title: Stunning surroundings, impessive waterfall, road bumpy but accessible with 2WD
text:
It's absolutely stunning setting. Not only the series of waterfalls but also the surroundings. It was just beutiful. And the Dynjandi waterfll is pretty huge. There are ofcourse bigger ones in Iceland but the whole setting around this one makes it special.

Hike up the waterfall is pretty easy. And worth climbing beacuse of the amazing view of the fjord.

The road up there is a bit bumpy but accessible with 2WD, just take your time and admire the amazing views on the way. We drove from South.

title: Expensive, crowded, but still an ok rainy day activity to visit once
text:
I strongly recommend buying the tickets in advance for example from the internet if you want to avoid the Lines. There is a long queue.

As expected, the place was crowded, so with some of the figures you had to wait a bit to get a picture.

It takes about 2 hours or so. It is quite expensive, but nice place to see once. I would not go again though, since I fell it's more of a one-time thing.

title: Excellent free gallery for art-lovers
text:
Loved it! A lot of great art to see from different time periods and different styles. Also the building itself is beautiful!

The gallery is free, which is absolutely great in such an expensive city. It's also nice that you can visit several times and see one part at a time so you don't get overwhelmed by it all.

title: Excellent FREE museum for people interested in history
text:
Excellent museum. There is a lot to see, so you can't cover it all in one day. But since it is free, you can visit several times and cover one section at a time.

My all-time favorite are the mommies in the Egyptian section.

title: Nice views over the city.
text: Nice views over the city and the old port. Easy walk up. There are some small restaurants at the top and a playground for kids.

title: Nice and quiet rocky beach.
text: Lovely rocky beach a few kilometers off Nizza port. It was not crowded at all, nice and peacefull beach with dramatic rocks. I got some great photos from Coco beach. Easy walk from the port, took about 20 minutes even though we walked quite slowly.

title: Excellent location, ok hostel, good breakfast.
text:
Pretty basic hostel, nothing mind blowing, but if you need a basic hostel to sleep, this is a good option.

Location of this hostel is excellent, it is right next to the main shopping street and the main square so right in the city center, close to old town and the sea.

We were in a private room, which was ok. Sound proofing was horrible, so if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs. The room could have been cleaned better, there were very visible dust balls and some crumbs under the bed. The beds / bedsheets were clean and comfortable enough.

The breakfast was excellent for being so cheap, only 4 euros. Only thing that I missed a bit were some fresh things, like tomatoes, cucumber, salad.. But it was still definitely worth the 4 euros. One thing was very unpleasant though, which was no fault of the hostel: people did not wash the dishes even though it was clearly stated in the signs that everyone should wash their dishes. Some people just don't seem to care, it's a pity.

The staff spoke English perfectly and was very friendly and helpful :).

If they cleaned the rooms better, the hostel would be almost excellent for the price.

title: Upscale department store
text: Clean and tidy department store with designer brands. They also had some not so expensive stuff, like jewelry and accessories.

title: Great for people watching
text: Excellent place to sit and have a drink at a cafe and watch people go by on a sunny day. Feels safe even after dark. There is a great salad bar in the square.

title: Best doughnuts in the world
text: From here you can get absolutely the best doughnuts in the world. They bake them there and they are still warm and fresh. Amazing. Also there is a wonderful view over Tampere from the tower, where you can see both big lakes surrounding Tampere and the whole city. Right next to the tower there is a nice forest and some jogging pathways and viewpoints, so make sure to take a walk in there as well and admire the beautiful nature.

title: Worth a ride but nicer to admire from outside
text:
The historic yellow tram is important piece of the Lisbon streets. Just lovely.

The route of the tram is quite scenic and it passes by the most beautiful areas in Lisbon but I preferred to walk most of the route and spot the tram coming from narrow streets. The tram is a handy way to go up to alfama if the hills are too much to handle.

Be prepared for a crowded tram and not getting a seat.

title: Amazing castle ruins at the top of a hill.
text:
This is by far one of the most amazing castle ruins I have seen (and I have seen quite many). It was not overdone like some of these kind of places, but left authentic. There was just enough museum like stuff, like information boards and so on, but not too much.

The place has also very nice views over Sintra and you can also see the Pena palace.

Admission was 8 euros, which was ok.

Only negative thing was that it closed before sunset, so I missed the possibility of sunset pictures.

title: Beautiful monastery but I expected it to be bigger on the inside
text:
The cloister of the monastery is truly amazing. Beautifully and in small detail decorated stone walls and pilars were absolutely beautiful. Also the chapel was quite nice.

Judging from outside, i expected to see much more on the inside. It is quite small site after all and not much more than the cloister and the church. For that 10 euros admission was quite a lot. (Luckily I got -50% with student card though).

title: Ok site, nothing too amazing but beautiful
text:
It sure is beautiful but not that amazingly magnificent. It's smaller than you would think. Gube it a go but don't expect too much. I would recommend going during the sunset.

We did not go inside, just admired it from outside.

title: Nothing interesting to see here.
text: One of the most touristy spot in Lisbon. Nothing authentic about it. Many overprized touristy restaurants with sales persons, some international clothes stores and stores that sell tourist-stuff. Nothing special to see.

title: A place for foodies, quite expensive though.
text: Nice variety of food stalls, I can recommend for lunch! I don't remember the name of the stall I had my lunch from but I had fish dish it was good. The place was a bit growded and busy, but in my opinion it was part of the thing and the athmosphere. The portions are quite expensive compared to normal price range in Lisbon. Wine prices were reasonable.

title: Great area to wander around
text: Charming area with narrow streets. Great area just to wonder around and enjoy the charm of an old part of the city. Great photography opportunities with hilly and narrow streets with old trams. Check out the miradouro Nossa senhora do monte at sunset for great views over the city and the castle.

title: A bit hard to get to, excellent beach.
text:
This is one of the most beautiful beaches i have visited! It was a bit difficult to get there but absolutely possible. I made it fine with just sneakers, but i wouldn't recommend flips flops. Hiking boots are not necessary at all. The path is quite rocky and steep at some parts so you need to be carefull but it was not as difficult as i expected having read the comments on tripadvisor. We took the left one of the 3 three paths.

You can get there from Sintra railwaystation by bus number 403 to Capo de Roca. The bus goes in the daytime two times in an hour. It takes about 30 minutes or so and costs 4.20€ per person one way. There is a bus stop right there where the dirt road starts or you can walk from Capo the Roca about 10 minutes. From the road it took us about 30 minutes to reach the beach. Be prapared for the climb back up though!

The beach was almost empty, but it might be because it's not quite a beach-weather in March yet :D.

title: Nice lighthouse with awesome cliffs, windy!
text:
As can be antisipated, very touristy place, but still a nice spot to visit, it being the westernmost point of Europe and all. The cliffs to Atlantic are awesome and the lighthouse is nice. There seemed to be also a restaurant and toilets.

You can get there from Sintra train station by bus nr. 403. It costs 4.20€ per person one way and they go twice in an hour in daytime. Get the timetable from the bus companies info point right across from the train station.

Tip: visit Praia de Ursa if you are up for it ;)

title: Excellent café, great lunch and desserts, reasonably priced
text:
We had lunch and dessert in this great cafė. Portions were big and prices very reasonable, cheap even. We had soups of the day and paninis and they were great. Also the cakes looked super tasty and the one i tried also was very tasty.

Can highly recommend for lunch or something sweet :)

title: Nice views over Sintra, unique castle
text:
A bit expensive for my standards, and as can be antisipated, very touristy. The castle is certainly one of a kind though. The view over Sintra are nice and you can also see the Moorish castle nicely. It closed before sunset, which was a disappointment, because I would have wanted to take nice sunset pictures.

We took the ticket to the park and the castle terraces for 10,50 € per person. I hear there is not that much interesting stuff inside the castle.

You can get there on foot or by circle line bus that goes via Sintra villa and train station and costs 5 euros return ticket. It was quite handy.
place: Park and National Palace of Pena

title: Nice views, good food, excellent staff
text:
The location is fantastic, great views over Lisbon! Food was good, not mind blowing but tasty. Staff was very friendly and nice. Prices were avarage, we had salad and toast for lunch plus large beer and large water and it was 25 euros alltogether.
Can recommend .

title: Perfect for a stroll in a sunny day
text:
Just fantastic! Best place for a stroll in a nice weather or fir a run with many many other runners. Visit the mall and the umpire rock, those are the best spots.

Pack up some breakfast or lunch and enjoy them in the pench watching people go by or stroll around with a coffee.

A must do in NYC.

title: Perfect spot for a nice view over Manhattan.
text:
It was almost magical watching day to turn in the night and all of the Manhattan lights go on. I would recommend going in to see the sunset.

You can purchase the tickets beforehand for certain entrance time from the ticket office in rockefeller center. Be prepared for some queuing at least right before sunset (allthough the line moved pretty fast).

title: Beautiful memorial
text:
The memorial is beautiful and the athmosphere is oddly (for new york) peacefull and calm.

We went just to the memorial, which is free of charge. There seemed to be a quite long queue to the museum.

title: Unique green area in the city
text: Very unique place! Pack up some lunch or coffee from chelsea market and go enjoy it in the high line which is right behind it. The high line is a few kilometers long and it has sime nice street views over chelsea.

title: Free ferry, nice views
text:
It takes about 20-25 minutes from manhattan to staten island and it is free! You can just go to staten island and then take the same ferry back.

You can see manhattan financial district skyline nicely and the ferry also passes by the statue of liberty.

We went when it was dark and the Manhattan lights can be nicely seen from aboard

title: Great hike but shame on you all who litter the mountain!
text:
It is a wonderful hike, the best views that I saw in Scotland! The path is quite rough at times so I would recommend a good hiking shoes with ankle support, it's easy to twist your ankle if you are not careful. But I would still say it was quite easy hike. It took us 4 hours to the top and 3 hours to get down, I would say we were going on average speed with some breaks.

Bring warm clothes even in the summer, it is quite chilly at the top.

One thing that was a huge disappointment was the amount of trash in the summit. It a really a shame that some people litter these kinds of wonderful places! If you can carry your snack or water bottle to the top, surely you are able to carry it down with you when it is empty. Shame on you all who litter the nature!

title: Beautiful castle
text:
I hear this castle is one of the most photographed in Scotland and I don't wonder why. Personally I prefer these old looking and kind of gloomy stone castles more than the white and bright ones. Also the bridge to the castle is picturesque.

Note that in the evening the water is low so you can walk under the bridge. If you want to see it with water, go in the morning.

We visited the castle also inside and there are some great recreation in some areas that painted a picture of the life back then in the castle.

title: Confortable, clean, affordable hostel with excellent location.
text:
Nothing to complain. The hostel was clean, rooms and facilities were comfortable, staff was super nice and helpfull and the sevurity was on good level. The breakfast was surprisingly good for a one that is included i the price that was already quite affordable.
The location was superb! Very close to temble bar -area and the centre.

title: Interensting tour to an old prison. I learnt a lot! Highly recommend!
text:
One of the most interesting places I visited in Dublin! I learnt a lot and got to understand a great deal about Irish history from a very interesting point of view. The museum is excellent, a lot of interestung stuff in there. The tour to the prison was also superb, the guides knew their stuff!

A few tips: get there early! They start selling the tickets at 9.30 am and it is first come first served and there are no bookings or online ticket purchase. The prison is only accessible by a guided tours of 35 people that start every 15 minutes. We first went there in the evening and it was sold out so we had to try again next day. We needed to wait for our tour for a little over an hour, which can be easilly spent in the museum.

Extra tip for those still reading: first wednesday of every month is free of charge, at least it was the case for us in August :).

title: A nice, relaxing hamami experience! Not the most beautiful hamam, but if you are under a budget, this is a good choice.
text:
This is not the most beautiful hamam in Istanbul, but if you are a bit under a budget, I would say this is a good option. It was clean, the staff was helpful and I got what I paid for.

When I got in, there was only a couple of local ladies in there, so not crowded at all. I got the scrub and and soap massage (70 lira) and they were as promised and in my opinion, they were very nice and super relaxing.

I had a very nice experience in this hammam. I would recommend it.

Ladies, remember to bring you own hair conditioner of some sort! They don't have one, only shampoo ;)

title: Good quality towels, reasonable prices, helpfull and professional customer service!
text:
Professional customer service, very helpful and pollite staff, good quality, very nice shop!

I was reading earlier about this shop and I read that it is expensive, but in my opinion, considering the quality of the products, I would not say this is very expensive after conmaring the prices and the quality in other shops. The prices are set and for the cotton pastemal towels (hamami towel) they were from 20 lira upwards, so there is something for every budget! They also sell other kind of towels, soaps, scarfs and so on.

The staff told us about the different towels, about the materials, how they are made and how they should be cared. Interesting and usefull information.

I left the shop happy and pleased about the products and the customer service :), I would recommend!

title: The most beautiful mosque complex in Istanbul, not crowded and nice view from the viewing terrace
text:
From the outside, the most beutiful mosque in Istanbul. The interior was very simple comparing to the Blue Mosque for example, but still beautiful.
The are no lines, it is free and if you don't have your own scarf, they will borrow you one.

I just loved the surrounding buildings of the mosque complex, with the many many little domes, lovely :). Go in from the university gates, there is a platform you can get a great view to the mosque!

There is also a nice view over the little domes to the city and Bosphorous.

Over all, this was the nicest mosque we visited in Istanbul. If you don't have much time, skip the Blue mosque (which was also very beautiful!) and visit this one instead!

title: Nice place to get lost in
text:
This is a must in Istanbul! Even if you don't buy enything, it is interesting place to wonder around. Many of the shops have more or less the same products. I would have tought that the variety of products would have been larger. Many places have fixed prices and some even have price tags on the products, but in some shops you should bargain to get a nice price.

I was very surpriced how little there were annoying imposers! The shopkeepers were mostly friendly, helpful and fun :). In most shops you could examine the products in peace with no annoying sales piches.

Nice place to get lost in :)

title: Nice food stalls, but very hard to get to and from in a rush hour
text:
You can get to Ortaköy from the city centre by bus or ferry, but as far as I understand, the only way to get back to the city centre is by bus and the road can be very very crowded. So make sure you have enough time and nerves to sit in a traffic jam if you don't want to walk. A walk from the final tram stop is ok, I would say about 4 km or so. We went by bus and it was sloooooow, so we hopped off the bus and walked the rest of the way. (we walked faster that the bus could move)

From Ortaköy you get a nice view to Bosphorus, there are great food stalls (try Kumpir, baked popatoes and waffles!) and market with jewellery and all kinds of stuff to buy. Nice place to wander around a while or have lunch / dinner or coffee / tea.

title: An avarage archeology musem, nothing very special.
text:
Having visited many archeological museums in the past, this was nothing special. Very big so I lost interest on the way. Similar kind of pots and jars go on and on.

The statues downstaris were the most interesting part of the museum.

So all in all I would say that this is an awarage museum, nothing special, but if you are into archeology, might be worth a visit, specially if you have the museum card (admission is included to the museum card).

title: Interesting, different site
text:
This ancient water cistern was interesting site to pay a visit. The pilars were beautifully lit and there were also some huge fish swimming around in the water.

It is a bit expensive in my opinion, but it is different from the other sights in Istanbul, so that made it interesting. The costume picture place right at the beginning was a bit of a mood killer though. Totally unnecessary thing in a place like this.

The queue was not too long, we waited about 15 minutes.

title: Touristic area with most of the biggest sights in Istanbul
text:
It is very touristic part of the city, so it is not the best part to get an authentic picture of the city. But since most of the biggest sights like Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace and Cistern are there, you should visit them. But other than visiting the sigts, I would not hang around here, I would I head to Beyogly, bazaar disctrict or Karaköy instead.

Since there are lot of tourists, there are also lot of those touts selling Bosphorus boat tours and so on. It can be a bit annoying saying 'no tank you' over and over and over again, but they are not too pushy.

The tram is handy way to reach the district from around Galata bridge.

title: City centre with many interesting areas
text:
Strolling the Istiklal street is a perfect place for people watching. I heard that 2 million people walk through Istiklal a day. Also the old tram goes all the way from Taksim untill to the end of the Istiklal. So it is a perfect place to stop for a while and watch the people go by.

But you should deffinately also walk around in other parts than Istiklal street! There is a great, a bit bohemic area (around cihangir) if you go South from Istiklal. Small, rambling streets, old buildings, stairs, street cats... There are a lot of pubs and places to drink/eat in tiny streets west from Istiklal street.

Also visit the fish market! A lot of locals, especially yourger locals seems to stroll around in Beyogly. I would recommend having accommodation in Beyogly, there are lots o restaurants and bars in this area.

title: A nice, athmospheric brigde to have a little evening walk
text: You should deffinately walk the Galata bridge during the sunset, watch the local fishermen fish from the bridge, admire the Mosques in the sunset, watch the ferries go by and the seagulls flying around and watch the locals at Eminömü eating balik ekmek, and getting one yourself ofcourse.

title: The best 360° view over the city, the view on sunset was magical
text: It is hell of a queque (about one hour) and pretty expensive (25 lira per person) but it was well worth it. Absolutely fantastic view to Bosphorus and over the whole city. The sun setting over the Mosques and the ferries sailing on Bosphorus was absolutely magical. I can highly recommend for the best views to Istanbul.

title: Absolutely beautiful mosque. A must see in Istanbul.
text:
On weekend we walked by the Blue mosque and the queue was looooong, I would say at least an hour. But we visited right around 9 am the next day when it opened and there was no queue at all, we basically just walked in.

The mosque is magnificent, I just loved the interior, magnificent architecture. Quite a lot of tourists, but that was expected.

Women should wear a scarf over their heads and both men and women should dress modestly out of respect, since the blue mosque still is in use as a mosque. They offer a scarf to borrow if you don't have your own with you. The Mosque is closed during the praying times. It is free of change.
